conclusion: Determine the propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo.
Inner diameter of the sphere is R, outer diameter is 8R/3, incident angle is 30 degrees.
Using Snell's Law to find the refraction angle r.
Calculate sin r as approximately 0.376, hence r is approximately 22.02 degrees.
Calculate the critical angle C as approximately 48.75 degrees.
Since r < C, light is not totally internally reflected and continues to refract.
Calculate the length of path AB using trigonometry as 4R/3.
Speed of light in water is c/n.
Calculate time t using the formula t = d/v, resulting in 5.32R/3c.
The propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo is 5.32R/3c.
